sectionItem.title: Section Item
sectionItem.description: Reference to resume item to display

itemType.description: The type of item, used for defining which collection to read from for fields mapped to multiple collections

itemId.description: The ID of the item, used to defining the item in an collection array

enabled.description: If the item is to be included in the CV

version.description: ID of the version to use in the CV for the item

section.title: CV section
section.description: Section in the CV, contains items used to render in the CV

enabled.description: Is the section shown in the CV

items.description: Items under the section

duration.description: Summary of days worked and total days covereed by CV

total.description: Total number of days covered by CV

pct.description: A percentage of days worked vs total days covered

duration.description: The number of days in the gap

jobSpecMatch.description: Data from the job specification matching service

accuracy.description: How accurately the CV meets the job specification

name.title: Candidate's name
name.description: The candidate's name as it should appear on the resume.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

nameObject.description: The candidate's name as it should appear on the resume.

info.title: Candidate's information
info.description: The candidate's information as it should appear on the resume.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

infoObject.description: The 'info' section contains basic summary information for the candidate, including an optional label or job title, candidate photo, summary, and quote.

label.description: A label for this resume, such as 'Full-Stack Developer'.

image.description: URL or path to your picture in JPEG, PNG, GIF, or BMP format.

brief.description: A short description or summary of yourself as a candidate.

disposition.title: Candidate's travel disposition
disposition.description: The candidate's disposition towards travelling as it should appear on the resume.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

dispositionObject.description: The disposition section describes the candidate's overall attitude towards new employment opportunities including: travel, relocation, schedule, desired type of work, and the like.

travel.description: Percentage of time willing to travel (0 to 100).

authorization.description: Work authorization: citizen, work visa, etc.

commitment.description: Types of work commitment desired: contract, perm, seasonal, etc.

items.description: One of: contract, permanent, part-time, seasonal, full-time.
City or area of relocation.

contact.title: Candidate's contact information
contact.description: The candidate's contact information as it should appear on the resume.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

contactObject.description: The 'contact' section contains the candidate's contact information, including phone numbers, emails, websites, IMs, and custom contact types.

label.description: A label for this contact information.

category.description: Type of contact information: email, phone, url, postal, or IM.

value.description: Phone number, email address, website, etc.

location.title: Candidate's address
location.description: The candidate's address as it should appear on the resume.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

locationObject.description: The 'location' section, when present, contains the candidate's location and address info.

code.description: Postal or other official routing code.

country.description: Two-digit country code (US, AU, UK, IN, etc.).

employment.description: The 'employment' section describes the candidate's formal employment history.

summary.title: Summary of Employment
summary.description: A line to sum up the collective experience the candidate has had

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

items.title: Employment Information
items.description: Info about the employment

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

position.description: Your position or formal job title.

start.description: Date you began work, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

end.description: Date you finished work, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

summary.description: A summary of your achievements and responsibilities under this employer.

items.description: For ex, 'Led 5-person development team, increasing profits by 50% year-over-year'.

location.description: Freeform location of the job or position, e.g., 'San Francisco, CA' or 'Tokyo'.

items.description: For example, C++, HTML, HIPAA, etc.

projects.description: The 'projects' section describes the candidate's project history -- not the jobs the candidate has worked but the specific projects and enterprises the candidate has created or been involved in, whether paid or unpaid.

items.title: Employment Information
items.description: Info about the employment

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

category.description: Project type: open-source, private, side project, etc.

summary.description: A summary of your achievements and responsibilities on the project.

role.description: Your role on the project: Contributor, Creator, etc.

start.description: Date your involvement with project began, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

end.description: Date your involvement with project ended, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

items.description: For ex, 'Led 5-person development team, increasing profits by 50% year-over-year'.

location.description: Freeform location of the job or position, e.g., 'San Francisco, CA' or 'Tokyo'.

items.description: For example, C++, HTML, HIPAA, etc.

category.description: Media category: image, thumbnail, screenshot, MP3, download, etc.

skills.description: A description of the candidate's formal skills and capabilities.

name.description: Name of the skillset: 'Programming' or 'Project Management' etc.

level.description: Level of mastery of the skill.

items.description: Title or ID of a skill from the skills list.

name.description: The name or title of the skill.

level.description: A freeform description of your level of mastery with the skill.

summary.description: A short summary of your experience with this skill.

years.description: Number of years you've used the skill.

service.description: The 'service' section describes the candidate's overall service history in the true sense of the word 'service': volunteer work, military participation, civilian core, rescue and emergency services, and the like.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

items.title: Service
items.description: Information about service

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

category.description: The type of service work, such as volunteer or military.

organization.description: The service organization, such as Red Cross or National Guard.

position.description: Your position or formal service role.

start.description: Date you joined the organization, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

end.description: Date you left the organization, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

summary.description: A summary of your achievements and responsibilities at this organization.

items.description: For ex, 'Served on board of directors of national non-profit organization with 20,000 members.'.
For example, C++, HTML, HIPAA, etc.

location.description: Freeform location of the position, e.g., 'San Francisco, CA' or 'Tokyo'.

education.description: The 'employment' section describes the candidate's formal education, including college and university, continuing education, and standalone programs and courses.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

level.title: Highest level of education obtained
level.description: Highest level of education obtained (none, diploma, some-college, degree).

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

degree.title: Your degree
degree.description: Your degree, if any (BSCS, BA, etc.).

versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

title.description: A freeform title for this education stint. Typically, this should be the short name of your degree, certification, or training.

start.description: Date this schooling began, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

end.description: Date this schooling ended, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

curriculum.description: Notable courses, subjects, and educational experiences.

items.description: The course name and number or other identifying info.

url.description: Website or URL of the institution or school.

summary.description: A short summary of this education experience.

keywords.description: Keywords associated with this education stint.

items.description: For example, C++, HTML, HIPAA, etc.
For ex, 'Graduated *summa cum laude*'.

location.description: Freeform location of the education, e.g., 'San Francisco, CA' or 'Tokyo'.

socialList.description: The 'social' section describes the candidate's participation in internet and social networking services and communities including GitHub, FaceBook, and the like.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

network.description: The name of the social network, such as Facebook or GitHub.

user.description: Your username or handle on the social network.

url.description: URL of your profile page on this network.

recognitionList.description: The 'recognition' section describes the candidate's public or professional plaudits, kudos, awards, and other forms of positive external reinforcement.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

category.description: Type of recognition: award, honor, prize, etc.

title.description: Title of the award or recognition.

date.description: Date awarded, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

from.description: Name of the awarding company, insitution, or individual.

summary.description: A brief description of the award and why you received it.

url.description: A webpage or other associated URL.

writingList.description: The 'writing' section describes the candidate's writing and publication history, from blogs and essays to novels and dissertations.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

title.description: Title of the article, essay, or book.

publisher.description: Publisher of the article, essay, or book.

name.description: Publisher of the article, essay, or book.

date.description: Publication date in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

url.description: Website or URL of this writing or publication.

summary.description: A brief summary of the publication.

readingList.description: The 'reading' section describes the candidate's reading habits and is intended to demonstrate familiarity with industry-relevant publications, blogs, books, or other media that a competent industry candidate should be expected to know.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

title.description: Title of the book, blog, or article.

category.description: The type of reading: book, article, blog, magazine, series, etc.

url.description: URL of the book, blog, or article.

author.description: Author of the book, blog, or article.

items.description: Author name.

date.description: Publication date in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

summary.description: A brief description of the book, magazine, etc.

speakingList.section: The 'speaking' section describes the candidate's speaking engagements and presentations.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

location.description: Freeform location of the event, e.g., 'San Francisco, CA' or 'Tokyo'.

items.description: An array of specific highlights such as 'Won 'Best Speaker' award at 2012 E3 expo'.

keywords.description: Keywords associated with this speaking engagement.

items.description: A list of keywords such as 'TED', 'E3', 'mathematics', 'Big Data', etc.

summary.description: A description of this speaking engagement.

governanceList.description: The 'governance' section describes the candidate's leadership, standards, board, and committee roles.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

summary.description: Summary of your governance at this organization.

category.description: Type of governance: committee, board, standards group, etc.

role.description: Governance role: board member, contributor, director, etc.

keywords.description: Keywords associated with this governance stint.

items.description: For example, C++, CRM, HIPAA.
For ex, 'Increased company profits by 35% year over year'.

languages.description: The 'languages' section describes the candidate's knowledge of world languages such as English, Spanish, or Chinese.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

language.description: The name of the language: English, Spanish, etc.

level.description: Level of fluency with the language, from 1 to 10.

samples.description: The 'samples' section provides an accessible demonstration of the candidate's portfolio or work product to potential employers and co-workers.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

summary.description: A brief description of the sample.

date.description: Date the sample was released in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

highlights.description: Noteworthy achievements and/or highlights for this sample.

items.description: For ex, 'Implemented optimized search algorithm dervied from Slices of Pi'.

keywords.description: Keywords associated with this work sample.

items.description: For example, C++, HTML, game.

references.description: The 'references' section describes the candidate's personal, professional, and/or technical references.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

name.description: The full name of the person giving the reference.

role.description: The occupation of this reference, or his or her relationship to the candidate.

category.description: The type of reference, eg, professional, technical, or personal.

summary.description: Optional summary information for this reference.

label.description: Friendly label for this piece of contact info.

category.description: Type of contact information (phone, email, web, etc.).

value.description: The email address, phone number, etc.

testimonials.description: The 'testimonials' section contains public testimonials of the candidate's professionalism and character.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

name.description: The full name of the person giving the reference.

quote.description: A quoted reference, eg, 'Susan was an excellent team leader, manager, and operations specialist with a great eye for detail. I'd gladly hire her again if I could!'

category.description: Type of reference: personal, professional, or technical.

private.description: Public reference (testimonial) or via private contact?

interests.description: The 'interests' section provides a sampling of the candidate's interests and enthusiasms outside of work.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

name.description: The name or title of the interest or hobby.

items.description: A keyword relating to this interest.

extracurricularList.description: The 'extracurricular' section describes the candidate's involvement with industry-related events and enterprises outside of work. For example: attending conferences, workshops, or meetups.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

location.description: City, state, or other freeform location.

affiliation.description: The 'affiliation' section describes the candidate's membership in groups, clubs, organizations, and professional associations whether at the collegiate, corporate, or personal level.

summary.title: Summary of overall affiliation and membership
summary.description: Optional summary of overall affiliation and membership experience.

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

versions.title: Versions
versions.description: Key-value pair of version ID and version content

category.description: The type of affiliation: club, union, meetup, etc.

organization.description: The name of the organization or group.

role.description: Your role in the organization or group.

start.description: Date your affiliation with the organization began, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

end.description: Date your affiliation with the organization ended, in YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD format.

summary.description: A summary of your achievements and responsibilities during this affiliation.

items.description: For ex, 'Served on board of directors of national non-profit organization with 20,000 members.'.
